title.narrative: Pathway 2 Young Women Leadership in Kenya

description.narrative: Pathway 2 of the YW4A programme has the objective of enhancing the leadership of 17,540 young women (YW) to effectively engage in collective action and decision-making in public, private, and civic spaces in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya, and South Sudan by 2025.

title.narrative: # young women, with 60 % from marginalized communities, assuming leadership roles in public and civic decision-making at community level (disaggregated by cohort)

description.narrative:
This indicator refers to the number of young women in the cohort of young women who are trained in the ToT and who experience changes in leadership skills, experiences and practices. Leadership roles are measured by capacity to apply different forms of leadership training (to peers), willingness to become role models, self-confidence and efficacy, planning and facilitation skills, public speaking, advocacy, willingness to engage in policy change and with actors in public and civic decision-making spaces, exercise of leadership roles in the community, women’s groups, CSOs and political spaces, mobilization of young women, networking.
A Young Woman Leadership Score was created which is an individualised aggregated measure of leadership. This score represents the baseline value for IO2a. It includes the following categories, arranged from the highest to the lowest: A. Very Skilful, B. Skilful, C. Strongly Emerging, D. Emerging, E. Limited and F. Basic. By placing young women across six different categories, this scale allows for a more nuanced assessment of young women’s current leadership as well as monitoring of their progress in the coming years.

reference.code: WRGE indicator 5.2.2: # of individuals with strengthened capacity (knowledge and skills) to advance women’s rights and gender equality

title.narrative: # young women, with 60 % from marginalised communities, assuming leadership roles in public and civic decision-making at community level (disaggregated by cohort).- Aspiring

description.narrative: "A Young Woman Leadership Score was created which is an individualised aggregated measure of leadership capacity. The scale includes the following categories, arranged from the highest to the lowest: A. Very Skilful, B. Skilful, C. Strongly Emerging, D. Emerging, E. Limited and F. Basic. These categories are grouped under three large classifications as the following: Experienced including categories A and B; denoting high levels of acquiring the conditions for and the exercise of leadership; Aspiring including categories C and D; referring to young women who have potential for assuming leadership roles and; Starting including categories E and F; which includes young women who are in the early stages of their leadership journey. This indicator shows the measure of Aspiring leaders

reference.code: Indicator 5.2.2 Disaggregation by gender and age female Youth WRG049y
